verses.roman:
śuka-śārī uḍi' punaḥ gela vṛkṣa-ḍāle
mayūrera nṛtya prabhu dekhe kutūhale

synonyms: śuka-śārī—the male and female parrots; uḍi'-flying; punaḥ—again; gela—went; vṛkṣa-ḍāle—to the branch of a tree; mayūrera—of the peacocks; nṛtya—dancing; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dekhe—sees; kutūhale—with curiosity.
translation: Both parrots then flew onto a tree branch, and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu began to watch the dancing of peacocks with curiosity.
